caption: Great service and great food as usual. Restaurant was very comfortable. The sweetbreads are excellent as both appetizers and entree.
Happy hour was remarkable. Would highly recommend
We celebrated our anniversary at Bayona and had a wonderful time.  The food is incredible and the outdoor patio is beautiful at night.  A great place if you are in town and want a memorable meal.
We made a reservation to eat here and we got to the restaurant Friday night at 7:30 and the restaurant was closed, completely turned our plans upside down.
Garlic soup for the win!
Excellent dinner.  From the ambient, the service staff, to the wine selection, and the meal itself.  We all enjoy our dishes and definitely will come back

This is my favorite restaurant in the city. Lovely Creole cottage setting with a charming courtyard. Absolutely delicious menu with a reasonable diversity of options. Refined, excellent service. I've never had a less-than-wonderful experience in my many visits. This time, I had the quail salad and lamb loin and they were perfection. Thank you, Susan Spicer & team!
Excellent food, service and atmosphere.

A restaurant with an excellent wine list, clearly a great sommelier abides here, and a changing menu that keeps Chef's Susan Spicer's flagship eatery going strong. You can spend an afternoon schmoozing here with friends, relatives or business associates. One of my best meals was a lunch I had with my spouse and his brother.  We started off at 11 am and kept drinking and eating until it was 4:30 in the afternoon and lunch had been closed out!  Lunch ends at 3. They told us to take our time.  We had the entire place to ourselves, tipped mightily and were quite tipsy as we'd gone through at least three bottles of wine by the time we left. It was an event! It's a place where strangers will share their food with you!  Well, that's off limits for NOW, but the day shall return.  Filled with camaraderie and warmth.  Excellent servers and staff.
Great food and the staff was super helpful
Great food and great service.

This was hands down the best restaurant I’ve ever been to in New Orleans! The chef did an incredible job with the flavors and presentation. They accommodated my vegetarian diet and the chef made me a personalized entree based off of my likes and dislikes!! I couldn’t have asked for a better dinner and dining experience. And the staff was so kind and accommodating! I highly recommend Bayona!!

Food was Okay but the service was horrible. My parents brought the family here to celebrate my sister graduating nursing school. We rented a "room" upstairs. It was so small but cute, made me feel like harry potter. However the service was terrible. It took 1 hour before we got our first drinks and the whole meal took 5 hours. The only real memorable thing for me was one of my dishes reminded me of pine-sol.
Excellent food and Irish coffee!
The blue crab is so good.
Absolutely outstanding!  Martinique was Absolutely precious and didn't steer us wrong!

I haven’t been back to New Orleans in a few years now but I just Googled Bayona to see if it was still around, to my happy joy it still was! I go there every time I’m in town. I always make reservations before I go to New Orleans to make sure I get a table. The service, the food and the time I’ve spent in Bayona have been the best in the Crescent city. If the last plate I had on earth was their sweetbreads I would die a happy man. Truly a wonderful experience eating and spending time there.
Food was incredible... Slightly pricey but wow it was delicious
Food was amazing! Service was impeccable! This is a quaint New Orleans charm!

Lived in NO for years many years ago, but never had the pleasure of eating at Bayona. Loved the Happy Hour menu although the deviled eggs were my favorite, the crab orecchiette was a close runner up. My husband had the brilliant idea of eating here and I’m forever grateful.
Excellent food and service is a great combination!  Highly recommend it!

A lovely garden setting and attentive service was the start of a memorable meal at Bayona. From start, sweetbreads and garlic soup, to entrees, duck breast and lamb loin, our meal was delicious. The vegetables accompanying my duck were outstanding. My dessert of olive oil cake with strawberries and pistachio ice cream was a sweet ending to a near perfect meal.

Susan Spicer is a culinary artist and genius. She could also be a magician, picking different ingredients out of a top hat and combining them into the most creative and delicious dishes I have ever had. Her sweetbreads are the best and she has been sorely missed by the locals during The Time of Covid. Go, you won’t be disappointed!
Omg SO SO SO delicious! Kind of high quality and hoity toity but omg yes yes yes!
My favorite spot for quality Quality Meals. I love this place always quality food & service. This place has a great design. Food and feeling reminds me of Kansas City.
Beautiful courtyard, amazing food, and impeccable service. They observed all safety protocols, as well. It was one of the best brunch experiences I've ever had.

We have been many many times and I regrettably I often get the very tall waitress with medium brown hair pulled into a ponytail. I shudder when I see her bc she comes across as very cold, and unfriendly, robotic like waiter.And waiters, IMO, should be nice and friendly! Also, there is another waiter or busser with an extremely huge beard growing out of his mask. Why should anyone eating at an upscale fine dining restaurant have to look at that atrocity. What a mess! People are eating , there is food, its nasty! Tell him to shave it! Its so gross!! Have some guidelines. So bc of these situations, and super super slow service, we will not return for a very long time, if ever...
Quality Meals, quality stuff. Very delicious. Really nothing but enjoyable experiences here, I'll be back. The place has a great feel to it.
Good food just be careful the chef has herpes  and a cook they both shared it and total of 4 people have it their...
quality meals here - excellent. A favorite evening place of mine. Service is typically good. The place has a cool atmosphere. I can see why they have so many great reviews.
This restaurant is truly fine dining!  Beautiful decor and atmosphere. And the food was great too.
Loved everything here .

We had the most spectacular dinner for our 25th anniversary. Dined in the beautiful outdoor courtyard. We ordered a variety of dishes and shared. Everything was fabulous. Really appreciated Chef Susan coming to our table to speak to us. This us a MUST DO dining experience.
Excellent place! Love the staff!

Duck PB&J was absolutely incredible. Rabbit liver pate, totally special. Decor in and out, awesome. Service? Attempted to emulate the team-server styles of classic restaurants like Antoine’s, Commander’s Palace, etc… but instead of doubling or tripling the quality, it really just seemed to dilute the engagement of the staff. They’d probably be better off just dedicating a single server to the table and putting 100% of their effort into it.
Went there for our first lunch on our honeymoon and it was elegant, delicious and the service was wonderful! Thank you
I had high expectations for the food considering all the write up and rave reviews. We left underwhelmed. Outdoor setting and service were terrific.

I pass by street and notice someone eating...decide to check menu box( could use a light). Decide to enter although I was very under dress from walking Bourbon street and party in Mardi Grass. This is a nice and calm atmosphere. Classic even romantic. The front house was very helpful got me the dessert menu and  said not to worry about dress codes. I order as appetizer the scallops. They were perfectly cook and the vegetables and sauce pairing zesty but not hot. I follow with a quail arugula salad.  the quail had a delicious smokiness with a perfect crunchy skin and juicy meat the vinaigrette dressing that blend the fruit and pecans making this a dish to remember and come back for more.  The salmon in the wine butter sauce with a pickle and wine sauerkraut was the perfect entre. The butter sauce on the perfect cook crust of the salmon  was accompany with fresh greens beans and potatoes making a light but well and full meal. To finish I couldn't leave dessert been Mardi Gra I went for the King cake. King cake is more of a bread dough texture that is pair with a beautiful creme with ice cream eam fresh strawberries and crumbs that give the perfect balance. Let's not forget the amaizing Carnival drink that I used to accompany this magical meal sweet but not to sweet eith a perfect hint of mint garnish and a delicious cherry at bottom. so Bon Appetit!!!.  This isn't a cheap restaurant but for the confection, food profile and complexity is well under price and a hidden gem one street over from  Bourbon street.
Had a delicious meal there Duck with mint and peanut  butter sauce out of this world
Fantastic food and the chocolate creme brulee was to die for!
Food is good but wait staff doesn't control very noisy tables.

A true dining experience. Our party of six with one handicapped was provided excellent service. Every bite was perfect. A true exquisite dining experience. I'm so happy to enjoy Bayona with my loved ones
Food was good, waiter ruined what might have been an excellent experience.

This is for a special occasion. Intimate atmosphere with excellent food. They will plate food for you off the menu if you are vegetarian. I had trout which was very good, prepared with a Japanese flair. I chose peanut butter tart for dessert & it was really tasty. There is a large wine, beer & cocktail menu. Be prepared for an average tab of $55.
I love Bayony for it's new Orleans atmosphere!
Lovely restaurant, good food choices, excellent staff! You must visit for lunch or dinner while in New Orleans!

The menu should be registered as an antique. Not because Chef Spicer is trying to represent classic French Cuisine, but because she hasn’t changed her dishes in at least 10 years that I know of, probably a lot longer. She does employ young, talented kitchen help who put special dishes on the menu, but those dishes are hit or miss. She really needs to step up and reinvent her menu completely. To remind us who she is and why she is so well known and respected.
Very unique menu, great wine selection.
The food was delicious, served in a quiet and gracious atmosphere. All the staff was wonderfully attentive and really seemed to care for their guests.
Food was fresh and good, portions were way way way too small for $$$. Wouldn't go back.
Stopped in for lunch. Food was wonderful. Beautiful building and friendly staff.
Great food

Let me be clear: the food here was nothing short of delicious.  The service? Wow. What a disaster.  My wife and I were in New Orleans celebrating our honeymoon. Pretty much every guide said to come to Bayona, and, looking at the menu online, everything looked great.  The first huge issue was when we were trying to order wine. We asked for a recommendation of a drier white wine, to which our waitress went, "Yuck. I only drink Bordeaux." Well, alright. It's pretty common for waitstaff to know the bottles on their menu. She then goes and points to every cheap bottle on the menu, saying things like, "Well, since you're trying to save money..." and "Since you're on a budget..."  Frankly, our waitress felt like we didn't belong at Bayona the entire time, going as far as saying, "You sure? You might not like that," to what I ordered. While we were very taken aback by this, looking around the restaurant, we got an idea why she would assume we were too poor to be there. We are in our late 20s/early 30s as a couple, and everyone else in there was well into their 60s and 70s. The decor is what you'd imagine a fancy restaurant would look like in the 80s, with faded painted landscapes of classical Italy. If you're looking for a restaurant with a cool, inviting vibe, this is not it.  There is just too much good food in New Orleans to settle for rude service and dated atmosphere.
Very creative dishes and romantic atmosphere

Hit or miss with the dishes, and lack luster service. The Diver Scallops are absolutely incredible, an amazing and well balanced dish. I got the Fennel Crusted Lamb, which was average, there was an overwhelming taste of burnt soy sauce. My date got The Pacific Salmon and it was an outstanding. Very creative and refreshing. The dessert was well presented but extremely dry. We were quick to order but the dishes took an extremely long time to come out. By the end of the night my patience was spent and I was ready to leave immediately.
Amazing food.   Will go again.
Love the chef shelly !

Amazing food!!! We loved our visit to Bayona. I had oysters, grilled shrimp, and pecan tart for dessert. All were amazing. This restaurant should get a Michelin Star. The wait staff were knowledgeable and very professional. Try it you will love it.
The service was excellent. Every bite was scrumptious!
Omg the meringue dessert ,, I will never forget it🤩🤩🤩🤩🤩

Stopping in for a romantic little lunch date was the highlight of our trip to New Orleans. The food was incredible and multifaceted. The chef went above and beyond to personalize a dish for me (and even went to the nearby store to buy eggplant!) I would fly back to New Orleans just to go here! Charming, detail-oriented staff make this an experience to remember. I’m picky—they’re perfect.
Amazing food, fantastic service, and an elegant, romantic atmosphere!  Loved it!!!
Beautiful atmosphere, excellent service, accessible location, cute courtyard. I personally did not enjoy my food, but I think it's because all I really wanted was what they've got at B. B. Kings.
Outstanding Thanksgiving dinner with family.  Beautiful patio sitting area, excellent service, and above all great food.  Definitely one of my most memorable holiday dinners.

I had a far less than stellar dining experience at Bayona. I was excited to finally try this restaurant after several missed attempts at snagging a reservation. I made reservations for a party of 11 for a birthday dinner hoping I’d impress the group with my superior gastronomic knowledge of local fine establishments. Initially the staff was pleasant enough, but as the night wore on they became significantly less and less attentive and by the end of our meal I sensed they just wanted us to leave. The filet I ordered was tough, difficult to chew and probably both the worst and priciest cut of beef I've ever had. Because no one ever circled back to our table after our entrées were served, I never had a chance to express my disappointment.  At a fine dining establishment I expected our waitress to show some concern after the busboy cleared my barely touched, inedible entrée. Nope, she was totally unbothered and proceeded to serve us our bill + gratuity for a party of 11. I've received better service at Coop's Place. I chopped it up as a loss. Maybe those missed attempts at reservations were God's way of keeping me from having a rotten experience :(.
Ho him on the food and service. Ambience is very pretty.
Amazing highly recommend

Pretty underwhelmed with Bayona I have to say. I ate here last weekend. They lost my reservation (although they were able to still seat my party pretty quickly). Front of house staff were not that polished. Was not offered any drinks while we waited for our table. They also did not have any dedicated vegetarian entrees on their menu. They claimed they could make any of the entrees vegetarian but all they did was take the meat off the plate to make it vegetarian without substituting it with anything else. I felt bad for the two vegetarians in our party for basically having a tiny salad as a main. For a restaurant at this level- not having dedicated vegetarian dishes/ not being able to have the chef put a creative one together is horrible practice. Also the service is on the slower side which you start to notice. With so many good options in New Orleans- Bayona is a miss.
Delicious food. Great environment
The dessert was the best part. Hats off to the pastry chef. The main dishes were fine, but not exciting, especially for the price. You can find amazing food in this city for much less.

We chose them for our Anniversary. It was the perfect choice. The service was wonderful and the food was delicious. My husband had the duck and swears he has not had anything better. Thanks for making this Anniversary memorable.
Food is excellent. Service impeccable.
Delicious, but I found it too expensive. The cheapest main dish was $30+
We had lunch in Bayona's courtyard which is quiet and serene, enjoyed a delicious soup and salad, and were shown the true epitome of Southern Hospitality.

I really enjoyed my lunch at Bayona. The atmosphere was relaxed and quiet, great for a little business get together. Everything we had was delicious - great cocktails, the mussels were so tasty, the crab dish was incredible and the lamb meatballs - so good!! The desserts were amazing too. We stayed a VERY long time and never felt rushed or like we were holding up the staff. (thanks for that!) Highly recommended.
We sat in the courtyard and had a delicious, romantic dinner with the perfect wine. Love this place!

Food was cold, service was slow molasses runs faster. My steak was full of gristle and not cook. I wanted medium came almost raw. My husband's pork chop was like warm.  Waiting 60 minutes for food is ridiculous.  The place is overrated. Don't waste your money go to Galatoires or Commander's Palace even Wendy's beat this place on the night we ate there.
Great service, food, and atmosphere.  Never disappoints.
Wonderful meal. Service was awesome.  Great menu.

The food is excellent but the service is lousy!!! The staff appears unorganized and taking longer time than I have  ever experienced. There is just no order - you don’t even see the staff , you don’t know where they are. Maybe too few staff and overworked? When we pointed it out we were  informed that it takes time at this restaurant! Hence, if you come here, please be aware that there is no fast service. Excellent, if you have two-three hours available to enjoy good food!
Delicious dinner and appetizers in a lovely setting
Susan Spicer is the best chef in New Orleans. Met her after she was featured on great chefs of New Orleans and been going to Bayona ever since. She was one of the leaders in the Katrina recovery.

An amazing unpretentious dining experience. The dining rooms are relaxing, the staff attentive but not intrusive, the food fabulous (we had rabbit two ways, lamb, etc.), and the drinks excellent.  A wonderful dinner all round.
Wonderful  Meal!

One of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans.  The food is unique, tasty, and creative. Great service. My husband even suprised me and asked the wait staff if Chef Susan Spicer would come out to our table. She did come out and was very friendly. It was very nice of her to take time out of her dinner service. Thank you so much for the great experience!
Outstanding food. Wonderful atmosphere. Quiet.

Took a long time for the entree to arrive without any explanation when it did arrive.  The part that threw me over the edge was that part of me felt discriminated against. Waiter bumped into me a couple of times. My food was always the last to arrive for no particular reason. I was the only one who felt the food was realllllly heavy on the salt. Other said that their food taste okay. One more time, the time to serve entree was absurd
We are in love with the food here. Everything and everyone is amazing. We had seard tuna and banana tart. Susan Spice, the chef came to our table ❤
Don't miss the garlic soup! And the restaurant week special three course menu was an unexpected treat. Save room for the pavlova with lemon curd and blueberries...
Really good food, worth the wait.

I'm sad to say we were a little disappointed in the food on this visit. The service was excellent as usual. We had dinner with a couple of friends and enjoying it; however, we didn't feel like it was up to the usual quality that this restaurant delivers.  The new York strip should be replaced with a ribeye or it should be prepared differently.  It was rubbery! Perhaps it was just an isolated incident, we might try it again.

I had never experienced the phenomenal service that this staff had given our party. Even at other local fine dining. My 4 year old started complaining of a tummy ache soon after we were sat. The ladies at the host desk were so generous and kind! One of them actually took money out of their drawer and walked down the street to a small store to get my son children's ibuprofen! My son ended up throwing up in the dining room. I was quite embarrassed about the whole ordeal, but the staff and all the guests around us were so sweet and understanding. Thank you for the delicious 3 course meal and having the best staff a little boy could ask for!
Great food and service, our favorite restaurant in NOLA but please, remove this paper table cover when you have to pay more than 35$ per  plate...
Great Saturday special and the group was handled superbly upstairs

I am writing a review to describe the service and wait time of the kitchen.  My wife and I went to Bayona and were very disappointed by the time it took to receive food items.  Our appetizer took over 1 hour to arrive after we sat down.  Second appetizer came 15 minutes later and main courses were 30 minutes after that.  We asked our servers to speed it up, because we had been sitting for so long.  After finishing the main dishes, desert was another 15 minutes later.  I feel they could have done a better job handling the situation.  We were treated as if it was our fault for complaining.  Two and a half hours later, we were out.  We are locals and will not return.
If you're in New Orleans and up for a great meal, you must book a table at Bayona. Their exceptional service is topped by top quality food that tastes delicious. The chefs here do an outstanding job.

Garlic Soup. This was fantastic. The description does this dish zero justice. You need to order it. If you need convincing, ask your server about it. I've never had a dish look this. Bonus: the price point is crazy goodScallops. There is a Greek touch to this dish I've never had before with scallops. I wasn't surprised when this dish was good but it was still different from anything else I've had. It opened doors.
Very nice place, excellent service and clean

This is a family favorite! Service is excellent and food is superb! It's a nice place with white table cloths. I love the entrance into this restaurant, very pretty. I can't name on thing I don't like, vutvwhat I can say is I eat so much good food I don't order dessert. From apps to entrees you cannot pick one bad thing.
Really fantastic dining. The salad topped with quail was superb.
The entire experience was fantastic. The staff was promote and welcoming and food was delicious and well portioned.
Delicious food and atmosphere is great! We took the Tuna and the gnocchis and the salmon = Amazing!!! Even the cocktail are super tasty!

Fabulous! We went last night for their Coolinary Dinner and it was amazing. Had the freshest Triple Tail fish, and the Asian infused taste on the dishes we ordered was done to perfection. The lemon curd with blueberries was sinfully unique. Will definitely go back.
I only stopped in for the garlic soup. Terrific! Also, It’s easy to make yourself. Recipe is online.
Consistently amazing. The service is always top notch, The food is amazing, and the Sommelier  is the finest in America!

While the food was delicious, our night out was absolutely overshadowed by terrible wait times. And I mean LONG. We don’t get many nights out these days and when we do we’re very choosy. We were very excited for this experience, but the lengthy waits kept us impatient and on the verge of walking out several times. The wait staff was visibly upset with the kitchen and I witnessed a server almost crying as she apologized over and over to a unhappy table for something completely out of her hands. I think this place needs to not let the Zagat ratings get to their head and focus more on properly staffing, managing, and understanding what their kitchen can handle based on strength, wait staff, and kitchen staff available on those day. I’ve never left a restaurant with strong enough feelings to leave a review, but this time I had to. Good luck.
Great birthday special.
Creative cuisine in an upscale setting. Shady courtyard and a lovely staff.
The lamb was amazing, so delicious!!! Great staff and nice atmosphere! Can't wait to return!!❤
best meal ever there
Greek restaurant awesome food
A great dinner with Bubbles! He took great care of us and we had a blast
The menu is mouth wateringly delicious and the chef doesn't disappoint. I can't wait to go back.

The service was absolutely tremendous! At first glance, I didn't see anything on tje menu. I just picked the salad and cruton with mushrooms. Well I was pleasantly surpriswd how good both items were and actually filled me up!
I was very impressed with how to prepare food,i will back soon
Fabulous!
Food was excellent as always! Service is a little slow but that's to be expected in New Orleans,  it's laid back here!

Spectacular dishes and fell more in love with every bite! We did the rabbit liver pate, quail salad, tapenade, pork belly, duck breast and rabbit.  Closing with the cucumber lemon cake and honey dew lilac ice cream. Have not had such an impressive line up of dishes in a long time. Will need to come back for the rest of the menu

First of all, when we walked in the host was very friendly and seated us right away. Our server was Peyton and at first she was very friendly. Brought our wine and appetizers right away. After that, we literally waited an hour for our main course. With not one check in from Peyton. We travel all over the world and know fine dining. Unfortunately I would not rate this a high end restaurant mostly because of our service. Usually at finer restaurants the server cleans the crumbs in between courses and when there is a delay in the kitchen, the servers are attentive and apologetic. We got nothing and her attitude became snarky. Maybe she was stressed but when we come to a 5 star restaurant and drop over $600 we expect a polite server and timely delivery or at least a check in. I did see her glance a couple of times as she circled around but never once said “ hey there’s a delay in the kitchen can I bring you anything’. That would have been nice. And maybe scraping the bread crumbs off the table. I think this restaurant is over priced. Food was okay and service was bleak.

Amazing food, but waited almost 2 hours for the food to come and spent almost 3 and a half hours in the resturant. My parents asked what was taking so long after about an hour and the waitress was rude and was basically like well yeah food takes time to cook and brushed us off. Didnt bring bread out until after we were almost done with the meal.
Great steak!

Considering I had been there twice before, I was completely surprised at how BAD the food was. We had seven for dinner and not one of us was happy with our entre. Most of the meat was extremely under cooked while the rabbit was overdone. I tried to get to someone who mattered at the restaurant to see if something unusual was happening that Friday night two weeks ago but no one answered the request I left on the website or the email I sent to the manager, Lyn Morein. I am very disappointed that such an reputable place could care less about such a horrible experience. As a manger myself, my intention was to get them some constructive feedback...but no one cares enough to even answer my email. I am sad to say, this restaurant has lost its way. With so many other jewels to pick from, I will not be returning to this place!
fine dinning good quality food.
The garlic soup was very good. The halibut was bland and didn't taste fresh. The strawberry ice cream didn't have any strawberries. A below average meal.

We dined in the courtyard.  Food lovely, service great.  But, and it's a big "but":  There were rats scurrying around. Not just one - several.  One ran under our table.  Another ran into the restaurant building.  THere were also loads of cockroaches on the wall next to our table.  The manager, when informed about the rats, cracked a joke about "as long as they don't come into the building".  When I called the next day to express my concern, she said they were trying to control it, but "it's the French Quarter".  When I said they need to shut down the courtyard until they have this under control, there was silence.  There was never an apology, or an attempt to make this right in any way.  It's not ok for a restaurant of Bayona's caliber and price point to have an unaddressed rate infestation.
Service has something to be desired but the food was decent . Commander palace is a  class above and much better service .
Hi, had an incredible meal, the duck breast was amazing.This is third time here always top notch.
The most romantic meal I've had. Amazing food and atmosphere. Reserve now.
So good. Hard to find at twice the price.
Food, ambience and service was all great. Grilled shrimp starter and porkchop were delicious.

Oder ed the salmon which was served with roasted potatoes and green beans on a bed of "cabbage in an champagne reduction". It was salmon on a bed of sauerkraut, 3 tiny potatoes and 6 string beans. All for $42. What a waste of money!
Outstanding in every respect!!!

Amazing food in the heart of the French Quarter. I was very pleased with our visit. Service was good and not intrusive. We opted to sit in the courtyard. It was very pretty however there is a refrigerator that was very loud. The menu has a varied selection and I’m sure most everyone will have a choice. Starters were generous. Mains equally so. I had a rabbit theme with pâté starter and stuffed rabbit for main. Both were amazing. I was surprised how tangy the rabbit pâté was. My partner had the shrimp and salmon. The salmon was cooked perfectly and very sweet. I can’t comment on the shrimp due to allergy. This is an excellent experience and very different from many of the places in the area that feel tourist trap like. I feel I had great value and would recommend for all.
Fantastic! Food is outstanding. Service is excellent.
Exquisite food, marvelous service, lovely wine list!
Best ever!! Please, give the duck "pb&j" a try!! So great. Best service and atmosphere. Also the rabbit risotto is very good. Great options. Enjoy! Bon appetit!

Absolutely delicious. Definitely worth the visit if you're here in NOLA. I've been for dinner and lunch during the same week. Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. For appetizers the quail salad is delish. For entree can't go wrong with salmon or duck breast served with spaetzle. For dessert the pistachio panna cotta. For lunch the duck PBJ was fantastic tho the pepper jelly made it a touch on the sweet side. Overall would definitely go back.
simply wonderful... every bite!
A bit pricey but well worth it
Went for a small meal pre show. Wonderful as usual
Great selections and well done entrees !!  Don't forget to sample the Garlic soup !!
Excellent food

One word... phenomenal! The atmosphere of this place is lovely it's very relaxed and calm. We sat outside in the back the weather was perfect. The service was a little slow but it gave us time to digest than relax and have good conversations with each other so I appreciated it. We started with the cream garlic soup which was so good and I just wish they gave me more. I ordered smoked duck PB&J sandwich my mouth is watering as I'm remembering the experience. My girlfriend's ordered the barbecue shrimp with grits and the lamb. Everything was just so good I would like to go back and see what else to try on the menu. It's very unassuming and so it's surprising how delicious and complex the flavors are, you can tell a lot of thought and love went into the food. Wait staff was very friendly definitely a place to go back to when I come back to NOLA.
Upscale Louisiana fare done well!

Recently went to dinner at Bayona; this restaurant is very vegetarian unfriendly. I ended up having their potato gnocchi (minus the sausage) and it was awful. I should have returned the plate but I didn’t want to make a big fuss while I was there. I’m never returning here again!

Hands down of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans. Even in a city with so many rich culinary experiences, Bayona truly manages to stand out. The food prepared by Chef Susan Spicer is fantastic and the atmosphere is very inviting. The menu changes regularly and I've been impressed with every new dish I've tried.

Some friends from Mississippi, who visit NOLA quite often, wanted us to have a fine dining experience during our New Orleans vacation, so lunch at Bayona was their first choice. And it was, indeed, fine dining.  Everything was really lovely. The courtyard was just beautiful, and the weather three weeks from now would make it the ideal lunch spot. It was a tad breezy and cool on Thursday (3/21), so they were very quick to accommodate our request to move inside.  We ordered a variety of dishes and sort of did our own tasting sample. Everything was delicious and came out beautifully plated. We also had some amazing desserts, and my sister claims the chocolate creme brule' was the best thing she had during our three-day visit. The Panna Cotta was also very nice with a very smooth texture and an unexpected herbaceous, almost savory quality. The fresh strawberries added just the right amount of sweet to the dish.  The service was also second to none, and the entire experience was just outstanding. NOLA has a frenetic energy, and when you walk into Bayona, all that slips away, and you are just surrounded by this comforting calm that comes with wonderful food. Over-all, this was a great final dining experience for us to top off our trip.
Outstanding food, excellent staff

Very disappointing place.  The food was not that good and there is a really strange mural of Tuscany on the walls.  We went there because it was on a list for romantic places.  There was nothing romantic about this place. The services was not good and nobody seems to know about there product.  For that kind of money I would not expect that.  It was a tacky place that is not at all with the money.

Thank you to the entire staff and kitchen at @bayonanola This was one of our favorite meals - ever. We loved it so much we are going back to eat lunch on the patio on Saturday before we fly out. Quiet atmosphere - wonderful food- 5 star customer service. Laurie the Maitre D made it happen for us. Tip- try the cucumber julip to start of your night. It’s delightful!
Simply superb. Everything was fresh,  unique and delicious. One of NOLAs Top 5.
Great chef!
Food was phenomenal and the service was spectacular. And the staff was super nice and great.
The most romantic meal I've had. Amazing food and atmosphere. Reserve now.
The food is extraordinary, we order the Berkshire pork shop and it was Amazing. They would have gotten the 5th star but service was not good, sorry!
Such great food and the service was outstanding! We will go back!
For ambiance and food

Beautiful restaurant in a 200 year old cottage with a lovely patio. The service was excellent, all the staff were welcoming and attentive. I enjoyed the Stormy Monday cocktail, Bayona salad, and Pacific salmon, finishing it all off with the chocolate pecan tart. Everything was absolutely delicious to the point I can't imagine having a bad meal here. The patio was surprisingly (and refreshingly) quiet considering Bourbon Street is just one street over. Highly recommend Bayona.

We discovered this place while strolling in the French Quarter on our first trip to NOLA. They had a lunch special for $30 per person on certain weekdays for the month of February so we thought we'd give it a shot. It was easy to make a reservation online, even for Valentine's day. We sat in the lovely courtyard under the banana tree. The lunch special includes an appetizer, an entrée and a dessert, and champagne. Sounds like a pretty good deal right? Even better, to our surprise, they refilled our champagne throughout the meal. We added a starter (veal sweetbreads) on top of our specials. We spent two hours enjoying the food, the wine, and the good weather, and we didn't feel rushed for a single second. The staff are friendly and helpful. I'm quite happy that we stumbled upon this place as I would have never picked this spot if I were doing searches on Google maps and I'd be filtering out the $$$ places.
Fantastic Salmon and wonderful table wines!
Service was excellent! The homemade ice cream was excellent!

If I could give 10 stars I would. Spectacular fine dining experience. Best duck I've ever had and the sweetbreads were fantastic. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dinner and they brought some beautifully decorated ice cream out for my mom as well. She talked about it all night. Great experience!!
Delicious.  Accommodating. Great food and service.  Decor needs updating.
Just mediocre vegetarian food options, staff does not know how to lay the table.
Good fine dining restorant
always spectacular...but did have an annoying waitress this visit.prefer bubbly in my wine
My favorite restaurant in New Orleans!
Truly outstanding meal and service.
Excellent meal. Great service.
So loved this hidden gem. Will definitely be back
Ran the prepared menu with wine pairings. Not the greatest overall meal I've had out of Chef Spicer's kitchen, but the Osso Bucco was as on par with her best dishes. And the garlic soup never misses!

I dined at Bayona and the food was very good. However the night turned bad when I went to retrieve my coat and it was stolen. Be very careful with your belongings in that establishment. It was clear that someone had taken my coat and left their coat which was a different size and color, days later still no coat or follow-up from the restaurant. It was a huge disappointment especially since the manager showed no empathy or gesture of caring.
Try the duck sandwich, it'll change your life.
Incredible!
Stay away
Always have a meal here whenever we visit New Orleans.
So good

Food was good. Bad experience with reservations and service.  Will make.it hard to go back in a town full of great restaurants.  Such a major disappointment.  Sent a communication to owners. No reply. Such a major disappointment.  Sad. Wanted to like it.
Amazing food and top notch service.
An "over the top" dining experience! Delicious food with a global influence served in a charming cottage with patio. Lauren was our Server and did a magnificent job!
Lynn the manager rocks!!! And the food is phenomenal
What a sweet, cozy restaurant! One expects a lot from upscale restaurants in the Quarter, Bayona will exceed your expectations.
Beautiful restaurant with a courtyard, great high-end food, friendly service but extremely slow
This cozy gem is a wonderful place to receive exceptional service, and unique dishes that put the "fine" in fine dining. We would love to dine here again when in town.
Just great
Impeccable service. Salmon was great, pork chop was, too. Worth the price.
Stunningly good meals

Pricy place, buy well worth the splurge from time to time. We had the braised short rib which was brand new to the menu. It was the most tender, juiciest piece if meat I've ever had. I could eat it with a spoon if I wanted.

This Place has a lovely courtyard with a great atmosphere but I went there for a happy hour that they have on their website they said it was no longer going on. I would consider this false advertising as they do need to update the website. Most establishments would just honor the discount on the bloodymarys but we left and went to another place that had bloody Mary happy hour and a court yard.. I will try back and edit my post accordingly.
Classy and delicios. Totally enjoyable experience
Awsome wine list, best somelier in the US
Highly recommend. The later at night it gets, the louder it gets however. Food & service were great.  Try the pumpkin carrot cake..yum!

A consistently memorable meal.  Definitely one of the better restaurants in New Orleans.  Our table had the King Salmon, the Yellowfin , and the skirt steak.  Each plate had a distinct flavor profile and you can tell there was attention to detail.  The raspberry mousse was wonderful ending.  Service and ambiance were impecable.  Nothing but high praise from this corner for Bayona!
Perfection, so glad I returned to dine!
Dinner was great!
Unbelievable food!!! Best I've ever tasted!!
OK food, great desserts, nice ambiance. Short, eclectic menu. Stick to the meats with classic preparation, skip Mediterranean/Indian/etc international dishes
Excellent dining experience...Great date spot!

Scallops were decent, lovely presentation. Stuffed quail was really good. The panna cotta was the best dish of all. The atmosphere and ambience were quaint and peaceful. There was a bit of hostility with the host upon my arrival due to me not having a reservation but the rest of the staff were friendly.
Great food and friendly service
The service is impeccable the wine list is extensive definitely save up your box and enjoy a really wonderful meal made by a celebrity chef that you’ll definitely come back for
You can wait years to go back or visit frequently.. And the quality doesn't change, the tastes are pretty excellent
FANTASTIC restaurant
Great location , fantastic food and service
Hadn't been in a long time and forgot just how good this place is. Am not going to wait so long before I return again.
(Translated by Google) Had a great menu! Kröner friendly and courteous and the food was excellent!  (Original) Super Menü gehabt! Kröner freundlich und zuvorkommend und das Essen hervorragend!
Visited on NO Secret tours; which was amazing!  The PBJ w/duck was a great surprise!

A definite worthy choice among the maze of great restaurants New Orleans offers for navigation. Tried the garlic soup which was recommended and did not disappoint. Unexpectedly good for such a strong base tangible such as garlic. Everything was excellent. What stood out? If I went back and had to pick just one entrée and finish dish it would be the pan roasted Pompano and the smoked duck puffed pastry although I believe the menu items change so these choices may not be available on a next visit. Good Cocktails also..! Cheers..!!
Awesome experience! Amazing flavors bursting out of a 220 year old Creole cottage.
The Coolinary experience/menu was awesome!

Great weekend lunch here.   They have a three course, small plates menu.  The two biggest highlights were, the carrot soup and the duck pastry.  Friendly service.   An elegant setting in a beautiful, historic building which is surprisingly quiet for being just one block off bourbon.
Fine dining at its best
This place is so good.  It’s off the beaten path and full of locals.  I got lucky when my Uber driver found out where I was going and dropped me off here instead!
Delicious dinner! The lamb carpaccio was just amazing!
Great service.   Meal was good but not great.   Was hoping in was more NOLA inspired menu.   Alot of international flare, Asian and Indian.    Would recommend trying it.
Wonderful dinning. Food was amazing. Great service.
Good place. Ate there in 2000 and 2018. It was much better the first time. I get the feeling they are pinching pennies now.
This will be a classic experience for anyone.It is a hidden gem.If this restaurant was in the Fan district of Richmond ,my town it would definitely be a hit.Try the rabbit!
One of my favorite restaurants in the USA
Amazing food. Everything , every little detail and every single  ingredient was just cooked to perfection . Every single bite made up for the long wait :)
Great food great service good value too
As my wife said "that was insane". Would recommend the salmon.
Delicious
Great food and great service with a very cute location as well.
Great. Food v

We wanted to come in just for some drinks and the garlic soup. We felt like we were inconveniencing them by doing this and made the whole situation uncomfortable, yet slightly humorous.  At this time there was only a couple people in the entire restaurant so it shouldn't have been a big deal. The garlic soup was absolutely incredible but apparently it's frowned upon to go in just for soup and drinks.

Top notch food. Server was pompas. We were not ready to order so she punished us. Making us wait 30 min before she came back. I'm in the biz and very aware of what was going on. So we tipped 20% instead of our usual 35%. Stars are for food. Service was 3 stars and that's generous.
The cream of garlic soup is worth the price of exuding garlic odors from every pore for the next two days.

A roach came out on the ceiling which made us move tables as almost made us leave. However, I am very glad we stayed, because after trying the food, if that roach had fallen into any of my dishes I would have used it to sup the sauce and eaten it. This is some of the tastiest food I've ever had, and I would come back any time.
The food was excellent and we really enjoyed it.
Outstanding dinner. Shrimp with black bean cake is fabulous. Creative dishes.
A Classic NOLA restaurant that truly lives up to it's reputation. Innovative and wonderful.
Lovely intimate restaurant in the Quarters.  The food and service we're great.
A favorite for lunch

(Translated by Google) Excellent food with a touch of Indian cuisine. Delicious drinks (tip: Royal Dauphine).  (Original) Ausgezeichnetes Essen mit einem Hauch indischer Küche. Leckere Drinks (Tipp: Royal Dauphine).
Absolutely wonderful in every way. Dining in the courtyard was very enjoyable.
The food was very good. Service was excellent. I got a salmon appetizer and it changed my life.
Excellent through and through. A thoroughly relaxing place to eat.
Incredible, one of the best meals I've had in a while. Atmosphere is a little stuffy as is common with restaurants of this stature. Request a table in the courtyard if they have one available.
Excellent food and service.
Just had the garlic soup and salad, it was okay. The service was excellent and staff was wonderful and very friendly.
We enjoyed our dining experience here. The quail salad was excellent, as was the shoulder filet with asparagus and an gratin potatoes. Great service!
An upscale place with both indoor and outdoor seating. Although it took awhile to get our meal food is well made and very tasty.
Sat outside in the gorgeous courtyard.  What a great lunch!
Food was AMAZING *****, service was ok, wait for food from kitchen was horrible. Over an hour from apps to entree and only 3 of 5 ordered apps. We were starving.

Oh my! What a foodgasmic experience!! Tucked away, hard to find, but well worth the search. Pictures show a few of the wonders that graced our table! Very high recommendations for this one! A New Orleans MUST!

The eggplant caviar was so incredibly flavorful. An unusual food item that was an extremely pleasant surprise. The cream of garlic soup is not to be missed. Smooth and so delicious. A reasonable selection of wines by the glass. Beautiful, small, and separate dining rooms and a a nice outdoor patio. Attentive service. Definitely 5 stars!
A superlative experience, staff with passionate people - and exquisite daily menus. Don't pass on the garlic soup, or the gorgeous Courtyard.
Food excellent as is the staff. Very relaxed atmosphere.
Great place for lunch. Just love.
Good service nice atmosphere and very accommodating. Food is delicious.
Went to Bayona on a Great Chef's  food tour by New Orleans SecretTours. The food was fabulous and the people there were wonderful. Met the chef,  Susan Spicer, which was a great thrill.

Whoever is operating this restaurant should be ashamed of themselves.  Our group arrived at 6:15, but salad didn't make it's way to the table until 7:45.  Dessert finally arrived at 9:20, by which time our entire table had left and my wife and I joined another table within our group.  The manager's response was that the food was "high prep" so it takes awhile.  It doesn't take an experienced manager to understand that if your food takes so long to get to the table that your guests are leaving before receiving what they are paying for that there is a serious problem.   Unless you have nearly four hours to spend at dinner, you should not come here.  Surprisingly, the food was good if you could look past it being served cold because one poor waitress was trying to serve 25+ people by herself up a flight of stairs.  The operator of this restaurant will ruin it in a short time.  Make changes now.
We celebrated our 4 year anniversary here. The food was delicious and the atmosphere very cosy - even though there is no background music. I had the garlic lamb, which was perfectly juicy. Perfect!
We love this romantic restaurant when visiting New Orleans. The Garlic soup is a favorite. The ambiance, service and menu always leave us with happy memories.

Don't let being part of a hotel fool you or keep you away. The food is top drawer and the service was excellent...waiter's recommendations were spot on. All of us had seafood and agreed it was some of the best we'd had in a very long time. We'll go back next trip.
A wonderful restaurant with excellent food where the chef, Susan Spicer, is often working in the kitchen.  From my experience, the food is always on point.

What a way to start the trip to New Orleans. Lovely space in the heart of the French quarter, all the food was amazing and the sweetbreads entree was out of this world. Wonderful service and they even shared some of the history of the restaurant.

My favorite restaurant in the French Quarter. Thoroughly classy, great French-influenced menu selections (like cream of garlic soup - mmm), terrific al fresco dining in the courtyard, impeccable service. Been around a long time now, and for good reason.

Went here for their lunch special, and was thoroughly impressed. My in-laws are fans of Susan Spicer, and really wanted us to experience it. Sadly, it was too cool to enjoy the courtyard.  I tried all the dishes served at the table, and they all were great: BBQ shrimp, steak, duck ‘PB&J’, and what I ordered, the sheepshead (pictured; not just a card game played in WI). Come at lunch to dine finely for less.
Disappointing. Cuisine lacked a cohesive vision. Staff not knowledgeable enough to recommend pairings well.
Great place to eat
Not as billed. Too expensive for what is served.
Friendly, formal setting but unstuffy.  Great, creative food.
Really good food, and a classy atmosphere.
Revellion
Always a great place. ..I stop here when ever I'm in town
Best place in town.
Beautiful and intimate restaurant with good service and even better food.
Amazing food
Very good service and food. Nice wine list.
great food ... great service...
Just Ok food high prices good ambience
Delicious food! Pretty surroundings! Attentive service!
Great place!
Fantastic!!! Beautiful dining room, wonderful service, chef cuisine out of this world!!!
Marvelous setting. Wonderful food. Will return often.
Absolutely the best tasting food ever!  Staff was awesome
Awesome experience.. always!
Beautiful place, amazing food and great service. I will come back!
Beautiful

I’m a little torn about this place. Even though my boyfriend didn’t want me to pay or get the Travelzoo I did anyway. I thought it was a really good deal.  The place is really cozy/romantic/classic french quarter fancy restaurant.  Our server was pretty good, but a little too much after we had a few drinks if that makes any sense. We both ordered the cesar salad which was done not like the cesar I usually get everywhere else. The dressing tasted a little different. I really wanted to try te Garlic soup, our server was nice enough to bring out a tiny amount so I could try it. Totally regret not getting it lol. We also both ordered the salmon which was kind of a mistake but not.... The salmon was good, but it was on a bed of choucroute. It was tooo much for the fish. I should of read what it came with. It ruins the entire dish. I ate everything but that.  The veal sweetbreads was delicious. One of the best I tried on this trip. We had the sherry-mustard butter. It was bomb.  The drinks were weak though I will say that.  I really wanted to try the quail salad because I read it was the best there. Maybe next time.  Overall experience was pretty good. Expect the weird chourcrotue lol
We enjoyed a delicious dinner on the courtyard with great service!
Amazing food and ambiance.

Tonight's visit to Bayona was simply wonderful. The weather was perfect for dinner in the courtyard and the staff made us feel welcome and tended to our every need without exception. They were there when needed and tending to others while we enjoyed the tasty treats from the kitchen. A lovely start to the evening. Thanks SS and team.
Just go and eat there. You won't be disappointed.

Order the stormy morning drink! The menu does change daily so when we were there we ordered the crispy fried chicken wings, BBQ shrimp and eggplant caviar. We left the played cleaner than a dishwasher.
Service was terrible.  2 hours for soup salad and entree. We came on a Monday. Every minute that passed the evening got worse. Over rated

By far the worst service of any restaurant. Period. If negative stars existed, this restaurant would be the perfect candidate. Please read all other reviews about terrible, rude, offensive service. They are all true. The ridiculous and cowardly manager decided to discuss a 7 year old's behaviour to support his argument. And he had bad breath. If I were the owner, I would be ashamed of associating my name to this restaurant.
The entire meal was fabulous.  I had the lamb and would highly recommend it.  The service was flawless.

As always, Batons delivered creative food in lovely setting. Garlic soup was velvety and delicious. The rabbit was prepared two ways, stuffed and crisp fried with a delectable sauce. I ended the meal with a perfectly portioned peanut butter pie and caramelized bananas that was divine. Unfortunately, the room was incredibly loud and service a bit inattentive, both of which detracted from an otherwise outstanding meal.
Amazing service and wine
Good, but not as great as it used to be.
Awesome ....
Unique flavourless, fresh menu every day based on what's available

Had really been looking forward to dining at Bayona. Our experience was mixed. The cocktails and appetizers were excellent. The service was ok, but not anything spectacular. The wine was amazing. The entrees were disappointing. Way too much going on with the redfish entrée. When we shared the concern about the entree's, the waiter appeared disinterested and brought our tab.
Food is outstanding and service is personable and attentive.

I don't normally leave reviews but I had to leave this review simply because I loved everything about dining here. I don't eat meat and I was here with my family, and when I mentioned this, the server automatically offered to make me a vegetarian entree, which made me so happy. I know this is standard for nice restaurants, but between the food, the server we had, and the atmosphere, I was happy.
